docs.lead_paragraph: A bill targeting potential security problems with the Obamacare website passed the Republican-controlled House of Representatives on Friday with the support of dozens of Democrats, despite opposition from the White House.

headline.main: Many Democrats Support House Obamacare Security Proposal
headline.print_headline: Many Democrats Support House Obamacare Security Proposal

docs.snippet: A bill targeting potential security problems with the Obamacare website passed the Republican-controlled House of Representatives on Friday with the support of dozens of Democrats, despite opposition from the White House.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican-led House voted overwhelmingly Friday to bolt new security requirements onto President Barack Obama's health care law, with 67 Democrats breaking ranks to join with the GOP. It was the first skirmish of what is certain to be a long and contentious election-year fight.

headline.main: GOP House Targets Health Care Law; 67 Dems Join In
headline.print_headline: GOP House Targets Health Care Law; 67 Dems Join In

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Harry Reid has engaged in the greatest consolidation of congressional power since Newt Gingrich led the House, unleashing a bitterness that may derail efforts to extend unemployment insurance.

headline.main: Reid’s Uncompromising Power Play in Senate Rankles Republicans
headline.print_headline: Reid’s Uncompromising Power Play in Senate Rankles Republicans

docs.abstract: Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid, with his strong-armed change to filibuster rule and iron-fished control of Senate floor, has engaged in the greatest consolidation of congressional power since Newt Gingrich led the House, unleashing a bitterness that may derail efforts to extend unemployment insurance.
docs.snippet: Senator Harry Reid has engaged in the greatest consolidation of congressional power since Newt Gingrich led the House, unleashing a bitterness that may derail efforts to extend unemployment insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite big gains, the decades-long fight to control tobacco use is far from won.

headline.main: Fitful Progress in the Antismoking Wars
headline.print_headline: Fitful Progress in the Antismoking Wars

docs.abstract: Editorial points out the death toll from tobacco remains stubbornly high despite big gains made in the decades-long fight to control tobacco use; contends percentage of smokers can be driven further down by using a range of new and proven tactics; urges the United States government to help counter the tobacco industry's efforts to spread its noxious products around the world.
docs.snippet: Despite big gains, the decades-long fight to control tobacco use is far from won.

docs.lead_paragraph: The new parity rules apply to most health plans and are effective beginning July 1, although many plans will not have to comply until January of next year.

headline.main: Understanding New Rules That Widen Mental Health Coverage
headline.print_headline: Understanding New Rules That Widen Mental Health Coverage

docs.abstract: Your Money Adviser column on long-awaited improvements in insurance coverage for mental conditions and addictions; new parity rules are expected to become widely available as result of major steps Obama administration has taken.
docs.snippet: The new parity rules apply to most health plans and are effective beginning July 1, although many plans will not have to comply until January of next year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hunkering down at home rather than going to work, canceling thousands of flights and repairing burst pipes from the Midwest to the Southeast has its price. By one estimate, about $5 billion.

headline.main: Ex-SAC Trader Was Expelled From Harvard Law School
headline.print_headline: SAC Trader Falsified His Grades At Harvard

docs.abstract: Mathew Martoma, who is charged with carrying out one of the largest insider trading schemes ever, was expelled for creating a false transcript of his grades, a person briefed on the matter said on Thursday.
docs.snippet: Mathew Martoma, who is charged with carrying out one of the largest insider trading schemes ever, was expelled for creating a false transcript of his grades, a person briefed on the matter said on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Record-keeping snags could complicate the start of insurance coverage this month as people begin using policies they purchased under President Barack Obama's health care overhaul.
